pullRequest.body:
We prove that a connected graph on n vertices and n-1 edges is a tree, with a few API lemmas along the way, including the existence of spanning trees of connected graphs.  

---

The large import is because we need some `Minimal` API. Invoking the existence of minimal/maximal objects in finite settings is standard in graph theory proofs, so this import should also be helpful with other things going forward. 



<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Girth`|66|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Acyclic`|83|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Connected.card_vert_le_card_edgeSet_add_one`
`+ Connected.connected_delete_edge_of_not_isBridge`
`+ Connected.exists_isPath`
`+ Connected.exists_isTree_le`
`+ Preconnected.exists_isPath`
`+ Reachable.exists_isPath`
`+ isTree_iff_connected_and_card`
`+ isTree_of_minimal_connected`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

I note the import change to `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Acyclic` but I also note that this is imported by just one file, which is a leaf, so I think this is an acceptable change.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14131741447/job/39593552445)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/14131741447/job/39593551938)
Looking great, and thanks again for doing this!
Looking great, and thanks again for doing this!

There is a definition for edge deletion which I think we should use (I note the lemmas above do not but I claim they should):
```suggestion
lemma Connected.connected_deleteEdge_of_not_isBridge (hG : G.Connected) {x y : V}
    (h : ¬ G.IsBridge s(x, y)) : (G.deleteEdges {s(x, y)}).Connected := by
```
(you'll need to add `rw [deleteEdges]` or similar to fix the proof)

I think we should be judicious with `TODO`s: we could easily stuff the library with them and it will just create clutter and a slight maintenance burden.

OTOH they are sometimes a good idea. In this case I'm dubious but I'll let you decide.
```suggestion
/-- Taking a strict initial segment of a path removes the end vertex from the support. -/
```

Again, I'll let you decide but I'm a but dubious about the `TODO`
```suggestion
/-- Deleting a non-bridge edge from a connected graph preserves connectedness. -/
```

Unless it is necessary to make the statement we should always prefer `Finite` over `Fintype`:
```suggestion
/-- Every connected graph has a spanning tree. TODO : remove the `Finite V` hypothesis. -/
lemma Connected.exists_isTree_le [Finite V] (h : G.Connected) : ∃ T ≤ G, IsTree T := by
```
(`Finite` tells us _that_ something is finite and is true / false whereas `Fintype` tells us _how_ something is finite. `Fintype` is thus data and opens us up to diamond issues since there are multiple ways for something to be finite.)
I'm very happy to be asked to do this! I'm not a fan of `Fintype`.

As above, we should prefer `Finite` over `Fintype`.

In this case we need to change the statement to avoid needing `Fintype`: we switch to `Nat.card`. This will require adding the import `import Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Finite` but as `SimpleGraph.Acyclic` is only imported by one file, which is a leaf file, this is an acceptable import change.
```suggestion
lemma Connected.card_vert_le_card_edgeSet_add_one [Finite V]
    (h : G.Connected) : Nat.card V ≤ Nat.card G.edgeSet + 1 := by
```
Admittedly some of the other lemmas in this file currently use the inferior `Fintype` spelling but this inconsistency is the case throughout the library: we are gradually shifting as much as make sense to `Finite`.

```suggestion
lemma isTree_iff_connected_and_card [Finite V] :
    G.IsTree ↔ G.Connected ∧ Nat.card G.edgeSet + 1 = Nat.card V := by
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SimpleGraph): a connected graph with n - 1 edges is a tree
